intro: Psychotria diploneura, commonly known as the velvetleaf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It produces berries that are often consumed by various bird species. Psychotria diploneura is also noted for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its uses.
